simplesect.title: NAME
simplesect.simpara: git-bugreport - Collect information for user to file a bug report

simplesect.title: DESCRIPTION
simplesect.simpara: Captures information about the user's machine, Git client, and repository state, as well as a form requesting information about the behavior the user observed, into a single text file which the user can then share, for example to the Git mailing list, in order to report an observed bug.
The following information is requested from the user:
The following information is captured automatically:

listitem.simpara: uname sysname, release, version, and machine strings

simplesect.simpara: This tool is invoked via the typical Git setup process, which means that in some cases, it might not be able to launch - for example, if a relevant config file is unreadable. In this kind of scenario, it may be helpful to manually gather the kind of information listed above when manually asking for help.

listitem.simpara: Place the resulting bug report file in <path> instead of the root of the Git repository.

Specify an alternate suffix for the bugreport name, to create a file named git-bugreport-<formatted suffix>. This should take the form of a strftime(3) format string; the current local time will be used.
